name: EUCED - Grupo Europeu de Cooperação Económica e Desenvolvimento
goal:
EUCED AEIE is a European Economic Interest Grouping established in Lisbon, Portugal, devoted to the promotion and development of European economic cooperation at international level.

Its activities aim to complement objectives and transnational synergies in the European Union and European Economic Area, as well as further strategic partnerships and alliances in other regions of the world.

EUCED goals and actions cover namely:

- facilitating economic activities of its members, associates and partners;

- providing internal financial support;

- fostering partnerships within its member structure and beyond;

- improving conditions under which its members operate and enabling further growth.

- bringing together, through economic scale and other associated efficiencies, the best available knowledge and expertise from its members and associates;

- providing new solutions and encouraging innovation and entrepreneurship;

- expanding the frontiers of knowledge and experience;

- bridge-building to new markets and cultures, facing the globalization;

- consolidating the global market (increase of economic growth and standard of living, mainly full employment, job security, consumer protection, environment protection).

EUCED is commited to actions to foster european and international sustainable cooperation and development.

As a valid instrument in the context of European and international cooperation, catalyzing dynamic relationships, elevating sustainable development goals and expanding European economic diplomacy and political knowledge.
EUCED EEIG works with Regional and Local Authorities, Academia and Institutes, Technological Centers, Development Agencies, NGO´s, Chambers of Commerce, Private and Public Companies, Businesses, Entrepreneurs, etc.
interests: Agriculture, Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, European Neighbourhood Policy, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Fraud prevention, General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
